page.title: 10THE HORSFORTH MUSIC FESTIVAL
page.content: The Horsforth Competitive Festival of Music, Drama and Dance has now been in existence for forty two years. The Speech and Drama classes are exceedingly popular and large numbers enter. In the prose speaking class for ten year olds for example there were thirty seven entries in 1985. Other popular classes include Bible reading, verse and Shakespeare reading, and the mime and solo drama classes. The music section ot the Festival is well patronised with music ranging from the recorder up to opera. The most popular class in 1985 was the cello for sixteen years and under. There are also many entrants for the vocal sections and the dance classes are even more popular. This event now attracts a Yorkshire wide entry.
